thread.title: Rory Feek honors wife Joey at Grammys a year after her death
thread.title_full: Rory Feek honors wife Joey at Grammys a year after her death

author: NANCY DILLON
title: Rory Feek honors wife Joey at Grammys a year after her death
text:
Rory Feek honors wife Joey at Grammys almost a year after her death Rory Feek honors wife Joey at Grammys a year after her death Rory Feek, who won Best Roots Gospel Album for “Hymns” at the Grammy Awards, spoke lovingly of his wife Joey, who died in March. (MIKE BLAKE/REUTERS)   7:46 PM 
Rory Feek paid a touching tribute to his late wife Joey Feek Sunday after the couple won a Grammy for their final project together. 
He recalled how their award-winning “Hymns That Are Important To Us” came out just a month before Joey lost her public battle with stage 4 cervical cancer at age 40 last March. 
“We sat together in the final days and watched this awards ceremony last year, and she said, ‘If we get nominated, promise me you will come,’” Feek, 51, shared as he accepted the couple’s trophy during the Grammy’s pre-show. 
“She said, ‘Remember, if we win, I’ll know before you will,’” Feek said, his voice breaking with emotion. Joey lost her public battle with stage 4 cervical cancer at age 40 last March. (Kevin Winter/Getty Images) 
Talking to reporters backstage, Feek said his wife always wanted to make an album of the hymns “she grew up with.” 
“When we made the album, I believed it was going to be special to my wife and (me), but I didn’t believe it was going to be that special for so many people,” he said. 
“When we were first working on it, though she was sick, she was going through treatment, we completely believed she would be okay,” he said. “So we didn’t go into recording this album like it was her last. It just became her last.” Tags:
